snippet: A failure to halt the sell-off in stocks in the last three weeks has shaken Beijing’s aura of invincibility and imperils the global economy.
abstract: Government of Chinese Pres Xi Jinping unveils new round of initiatives to halt steep slide in Chinese markets that has resulted in evaporating of $2.7 trillion in value since peak in mid-June; plunge in Chinese stock market could lead to decline in consumer spending and is most direct challenge to government, which in other areas has maintained aura of invincibility.

byline.original: By KEITH BRADSHER and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: A failure to halt the sell-off in stocks in the last three weeks has shaken Beijing’s aura of invincibility and imperils the global economy.

headline.main: China’s Market Rout Is a Double Threat
headline.print_headline: China’s Stock Drop, Felt by Average People, May Shake Leadership
